SEARCH
Package model

Class Inventory

java.lang.Object
model.Inventory
public class Inventory extends Object
This represents the inventory of the player in the game

The inventory stores all the collected items which includes the collected keys and the different type of boots. This also manages the usage and availability depending on how the game is played.

Version:
1.1
Author:
Melangelo Guanzon, Anton Luis Galido

  • Constructor Details

    • Inventory

      public Inventory()
      Constructs an empty inventory. post-condition: initialized with zero keys and no boots of any type

  • Method Details

    • addKey

      public void addKey(Key key)
      Adds the key that's collected to the inventory. pre-condition: key object must be initialized post-condition: key count is increased then marked collected

      Increments the specific key based on the color then marks it as collected.

      Parameters:
      key - the key being collected

    • useKey

      public boolean useKey(String color)
      Uses a key of the specified color that's from the inventory. pre-condition: key color should be blue or red post-condition: decrease the key count then returns true, false if otherwise

      The method checks if the key is available and if so, it decreases the count and returns the true/false

      Parameters:
      color - the specific color of the key
      Returns:
      true if key was successfully used, false if otherwise

    • hasKey

      public boolean hasKey(String color)
      Checks the inventory if there's a key of the specific color. pre-condition: key color should be blue or red post-condition: returns true or false
      Parameters:
      color - specific color of the key
      Returns:
      true if the key of that specific color is available, false if otherwise.

    • addBoots

      public void addBoots(Boots boots)
      Adds the boots that's collected to the inventory. Sets to true on the flag of fireBoots or flippers and marks it as collected. pre-condition: boots object must be initialized post-condition: is set to true, then marked as collected
      Parameters:
      boots - the boots being collected

    • hasBoots

      public boolean hasBoots(String type)
      Checks the inventory if there's a Boots of the specific type. pre-condition: type must be either "fireboots" or "flippers" post-condition: returns true or false
      Parameters:
      type - specified type of boots
      Returns:
      true if the boots of that specific type is available, false if otherwise

    • getRedKeys

      public int getRedKeys()
      Returns the number of red keys in inventory.
      Returns:
      the red key count.

    • getBlueKeys

      public int getBlueKeys()
      Returns the number of blue keys in inventory.
      Returns:
      the blue key count.

    • resetInventory

      public void resetInventory()
      Resets the inventory to its beginning state

      removes all keys and sets both type of boots to unavailable by setting to false
